title: Ticket #2864: remove arbitrary 60-second limit for DAGMAN_SUBMIT_DELAY
description:
Please remove the arbitrary 60-second limit for DAGMAN_SUBMIT_DELAY, and allow users to specify any value they wish.

[Note: this is almost certainly my bug. I think I had a specific use-case in mind when implementing this config variable, for which anything more than 60 seconds was probably user error, so I foolishly (?) enforced that limit in the code to prevent the user from shooting themselves in the foot. But as usual, the user (the future me) is cleverer than the developer (the past me) and thought of a new use-case the developer didn't anticipate, and doesn't need to be protected from themselves, thank you very much.]
remarks: CC'ing Duncan Macleod <duncan.macleod@astro.cf.ac.uk> since he ran into the issue while trying to throttle jobs.
